skill.name: api-testing
skill.description:
Use when writing tests for backend APIs or frontend flows.
Triggers for: unit tests, integration tests, E2E tests, pytest fixtures,
TestClient setup, mock data factories, or test coverage analysis.
NOT for: testing business logic that doesn't involve API endpoints.

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with no executable code. The verify.py script is a read-only validation utility with no network access, no file writes, and no command execution capabilities.

content.user_title: Write API tests for backends and frontends
content.value_statement: Writing tests for APIs is time-consuming and error-prone. This skill provides ready-to-use patterns for pytest, TestClient, and Playwright so you can implement tests quickly.
actual_capabilities: Create pytest fixtures with TestClient for FastAPI endpoints
Write unit tests for pure functions and service logic
Write integration tests with database and authentication
Configure Playwright E2E tests for React/Next.js frontends
Set up test data fixtures with JSON files
Configure CI/CD test workflows with GitHub Actions
limitations: Does not test business logic without API endpoints
Does not generate test coverage reports
Does not execute tests or verify results

use_cases.title: Test FastAPI endpoints
use_cases.description: Create pytest tests for CRUD operations with authentication and database integration

use_cases.title: Test React UI flows
use_cases.description: Write Playwright E2E tests for user journeys like login and student creation

use_cases.title: Set up test automation
use_cases.description: Configure CI pipelines with GitHub Actions to run backend and frontend tests

prompt_templates.title: Basic API test
prompt_templates.prompt: Write unit tests for calculate_fee function with pytest. Include tests for basic calculation, sibling discount, new student discount, and combined discounts.

prompt_templates.title: Integration test
prompt_templates.prompt: Write integration tests for the student creation endpoint. Test successful creation, unauthorized access, validation errors, and missing fields.

prompt_templates.title: E2E test
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a Playwright E2E test for the student management workflow. Include login, navigation to students page, form submission, and validation errors.

prompt_templates.title: Test setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Create pytest fixtures for TestClient with in-memory SQLite database. Include authenticated user and token fixtures.

output_examples.input: Write integration tests for the student creation endpoint
output: Test successful creation with valid payload returns 201 Created
Test invalid email format returns 422 Unprocessable Entity
Test missing required fields returns 422 validation error

best_practices: Use in-memory SQLite databases for isolation between tests
Test both happy path and edge cases including validation errors
Generate test tokens with short expiry for authentication tests
anti_patterns: Using production database credentials in tests
Making tests depend on execution order
Skipping error path testing for faster coverage

faq.question: What test frameworks are supported?
faq.answer: Pytest for backend unit and integration tests, Playwright for frontend E2E tests.

faq.question: What is the maximum test coverage recommended?
faq.answer: Target 80% coverage for core modules and 90% for critical paths like authentication.

faq.question: How do I integrate with existing test suites?
faq.answer: Follow the project structure pattern with unit/, integration/, and fixtures/ directories.

faq.question: Is test data stored securely?
faq.answer: Use test credentials and in-memory databases. Never use production secrets in tests.

faq.question: Why are my tests failing randomly?
faq.answer: Ensure tests are isolated, avoid shared state, and use function-scoped fixtures.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual testing?
faq.answer: Automated tests are faster, repeatable, and catch regressions. Manual testing is still needed for exploratory scenarios.
